1{-# LANGUAGE ViewPatterns #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | Clip token text.
5
6module Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token.Clip
7  ( -- * Char test
8    isSymbol,
9    isSpace,
10    isQQ,
11    isTerm,
12    isJudge,
13    isClock,
14
15    -- * Type
16    TokenScan, TokenScanMap,
17    ClipResult, ClipResultC, ClipResultCL,
18    ClipToken, ClipTokenC, ClipTokenCL,
19
20    -- * Clip
21    -- ** Updater
22    clipUpdate, clipUpdateC, clipUpdateCL,
23    -- ** Textual
24    clipSpace,
25    clipQ, clipQQ,
26    -- ** Identifier
27    clipSymbol,
28    --symbolToken,
29    clipSlot,
30    -- ** Term name
31    clipTermSign,
32    clipTermName,
33    clipTermQ,
34    -- ** Symbol
35    clipBar,
36  ) where
37
38import qualified Data.Char                              as Ch
39import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture               as O
40import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base                   as B
41import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Symbol          as S
42import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token.Token     as S
43import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Symbol.Message  as Msg
44import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token.Message   as Msg
45
46
47-- ============================================  Char test
48
49-- | Test character is symbolic.
50isSymbol :: O.Test Char
51isSymbol = S.isSymbolChar
52
53-- | Test character is space.
54isSpace :: O.Test Char
55isSpace = Ch.isSpace
56
57-- | Test character is double-quote.
58isQQ :: O.Test Char
59isQQ = ( == '"' )
60
61-- | Test character is term slash.
62isTerm :: O.Test Char
63isTerm = ( == '/' )
64
65-- | Test character is content line, i.e., @\'-\'@ or @\'=\'@.
66isJudge :: O.Test Char
67isJudge = ( `elem` "-=" )  -- Punctuation | Symbol
68
69-- | Test character is component of clock text.
70isClock :: O.Test Char
71isClock c = Ch.isDigit c || c `elem` ".:'+-"
72
73
74-- ============================================  Type
75
76-- | Code scanner for token list.
77type TokenScan = B.CodeScan String S.Token
78
79-- | Read single token.
80type TokenScanMap = O.Map TokenScan
81
82-- | Clip single-token result.
83type ClipResult = (S.InputText, S.Token)
84
85-- | Clip single-token result with word cache.
86type ClipResultC = (B.WordCache, S.InputText, S.Token)
87
88-- | Clip multiple-tokens result with word cache.
89type ClipResultCL = (B.WordCache, S.InputText, [S.Token])
90
91-- | Clip a next token.
92type ClipToken = B.CodePos -> S.InputText -> ClipResult
93
94-- | Clip a next token with word cache.
95type ClipTokenC = B.CodePos -> B.WordCache -> S.InputText -> ClipResultC
96
97-- | Clip a next token with word cache.
98type ClipTokenCL = B.CodePos -> B.WordCache -> S.InputText -> ClipResultCL
99
100
101-- ============================================  Clip
102
103-- | Update token scanner by clip result.
104clipUpdate :: TokenScan -> ClipResult -> TokenScan
105clipUpdate r (cs, tok) = B.codeUpdate cs tok r
106
107-- | Update token scanner by clip result with word cache.
108clipUpdateC :: TokenScan -> ClipResultC -> TokenScan
109clipUpdateC r (wtab, cs, tok) = B.codeUpdateWords wtab cs tok r
110
111-- | Update token scanner by clip result with word cache.
112clipUpdateCL :: TokenScan -> ClipResultCL -> TokenScan
113clipUpdateCL r (wtab, cs, toks) = B.codeUpdateListWords wtab cs toks r
114
115-- ---------------------------------  Textual
116
117-- | Clip space token.
118--
119--   >>> clipSpace B.def "  foo bar baz"
120--   ("foo bar baz", TSpace /0.0.0/ 3)
121--
122clipSpace :: ClipToken
123clipSpace cp cs =
124    let (cs', n) = S.nextSpace cs
125    in (cs', S.TSpace cp $ n + 1)
126
127-- | Clip single-quoted text.
128--
129--   >>> clipQ B.def O.emptyWordCache "foo bar baz"
130--   (Cache 8 ["foo"] [], " bar baz", TText /0.0.0/ TextQ "foo")
131--
132clipQ :: ClipTokenC
133clipQ cp wtab cs =
134    case S.nextSymbolPlain cs of
135      Right (cs', w) -> symbolToken S.TextQ w cp wtab cs'
136      Left a         -> (wtab, [], S.TUnknown cp cs a)
137
138-- | Clip double-quoted text.
139--
140--   >>> clipQQ B.def O.emptyWordCache "foo\" bar baz"
141--   (Cache 8 ["foo"] [], " bar baz", TText /0.0.0/ TextQQ "foo")
142--
143clipQQ :: ClipTokenC
144clipQQ cp wtab cs =
145    case S.nextQQ cs of
146      Left a         -> (wtab, [], S.TUnknown cp cs a)
147      Right (cs', w) -> case O.cacheGet wtab w of
148                          (wtab', w') -> (wtab', cs', S.TText cp S.TextQQ w')
149
150-- ---------------------------------  Identifier
151
152-- | Clip symbolic token.
153--
154--   >>> clipSymbol B.def O.emptyWordCache "foo bar baz"
155--   (Cache 8 ["foo"] [], " bar baz", TText /0.0.0/ TextRaw "foo")
156--
157clipSymbol :: ClipTokenC
158clipSymbol cp wtab cs =
159    let (cs', sym) = S.nextSymbol cs
160    in case sym of
161         S.SymbolShort pre w  -> (wtab, cs', S.TShort cp pre w)
162         S.SymbolCommon    w  -> symbolToken S.TextRaw w cp wtab cs'
163         S.SymbolGeneral   w  -> symbolToken S.TextRaw w cp wtab cs'
164         S.SymbolPlain     w  -> symbolToken S.TextRaw w cp wtab cs'
165         S.SymbolNumeric   w  -> symbolToken S.TextRaw w cp wtab cs'
166         S.SymbolUnknown   w  -> (wtab, [], S.unknownToken cp cs $ Msg.forbiddenInput w)
167
168-- | Create symbolic token.
169symbolToken :: S.TextForm -> String -> ClipTokenC
170symbolToken f w cp wtab cs =
171    case O.cacheGet wtab w of
172      (wtab', w') -> (wtab', cs, S.TText cp f w')
173
174-- | Clip slot name, like @\@foo@.
175--
176--   >>> clipSlot 1 B.def "foo bar baz"
177--   (" bar baz", TSlot /0.0.0/ 1 "foo")
178--
179clipSlot :: Int -> ClipToken
180clipSlot n cp cs =
181    case S.nextSymbolPlain cs of
182      Right (cs', w) -> (cs', S.TSlot cp n w)
183      Left a         -> ([], S.TUnknown cp cs a)
184
185-- ---------------------------------  Term
186
187-- | Clip signed term name.
188--
189--   >>> clipTermSign "+/" B.def Map.empty "foo bar baz"
190--   (fromList [("foo","foo")], " bar baz", [TTerm <I0-L0-C0> "+/foo"])
191--
192clipTermSign :: String -> ClipTokenCL
193clipTermSign = clipTerm False
194
195-- | Clip term name.
196--
197--   >>> clipTermName B.def Map.empty "foo bar baz"
198--   (fromList [("foo","foo")], " bar baz", [TTerm <I0-L0-C0> "/foo"])
199--
200clipTermName :: ClipTokenCL
201clipTermName = clipTerm False "/"
202
203-- | Clip quoted term.
204--
205--   >>> clipTermQ B.def Map.empty "foo bar baz"
206--   (fromList [], " bar baz", [TText <I0-L0-C0> TextTerm "foo"])
207--
208clipTermQ :: ClipTokenCL
209clipTermQ = clipTerm True "/"
210
211-- | Clip term name or a term path.
212clipTerm :: Bool -> String -> ClipTokenCL
213clipTerm q slash cp wtab cs0 = word [] cs0 where
214    word ns ccs@(O.uncons -> Just (c, cs))
215        | c == '='    = call (S.nextSymbolPlain cs)  (\w -> nterm ns w)
216        | isSymbol c  = call (S.nextSymbolPlain ccs) (\w -> term (w : ns))
217        | isQQ c      = call (S.nextQQ cs)           (\w -> term (w : ns))
218    word _ _          = (wtab, [], [S.unknownToken cp cs0 Msg.expOrdSym])
219    call e f          = case e of
220                          Right (cs', w) -> f w cs'
221                          Left a         -> (wtab, [], [S.TUnknown cp cs0 a])
222
223    nterm ns w cs'    = let w' = show (O.getIx cp) ++ ('=' : w)
224                        in term (w' : ns) cs'
225
226    term ns (O.uncons -> Just (c, cs))
227        | isTerm c    = word ns cs
228    term [n] cs
229        | not q       = case O.cacheGet wtab $ slash ++ n of
230                          (wtab', n') -> (wtab', cs, [S.TTerm cp n'])
231    term ns cs
232        | q           = case ns of
233                          [n] -> (wtab, cs, [S.TText cp S.TextTerm n])
234                          _   -> (wtab, cs, [S.unknownToken cp cs0 Msg.expOrdSym])
235        | otherwise   = (wtab, cs, termPath (S.TTerm cp <$> ns))
236
237    termPath [t]      = [t]
238    termPath ts       = [S.TClose cp "-)"] ++ ts ++ [S.TOpen cp "(-"]
239
240-- ---------------------------------  Symbol
241
242-- | Clip token beginning with @"|"@.
243--
244--   >>> clipBar B.def "-- C"
245--   (" C", TText /0.0.0/ TextBar "|--")
246--
247--   >>> clipBar B.def "| ..."
248--   ("...", TText /0.0.0/ TextRaw "||")
249--
250--   >>> clipBar B.def "12:00| ..."
251--   (" ...", TText /0.0.0/ TextBar "|12:00|")
252--
253clipBar :: B.CodePos -> String -> ClipResult
254clipBar cp cs0 = bar (0 :: Int) cs0 where
255    text n = '|' : take n cs0
256    barToken n = S.TText cp S.TextBar $ text n
257    rawToken n = S.TText cp S.TextRaw $ text n
258
259    bar n (O.uncons -> Just (c, cs))
260        | c == '|'              = bar   (n + 1) cs
261        | n == 0 && isJudge c   = judge (n + 1) cs
262        | n == 0 && isSymbol c  = clock (n + 1) cs
263    bar n cs = (O.trimBegin cs, rawToken n)   -- '||'
264
265    -- judgement sign, like |--, |-x
266    judge n (O.uncons -> Just (c, cs))
267        | isJudge c || Ch.isAlpha c  = judge (n + 1) cs
268        | isSymbol c                 = clock n (c:cs)
269    judge n cs                       = (cs, barToken n)
270
271    -- clock, like |03:30|
272    clock n (O.uncons -> Just (c, cs))
273        | c == '|'                   = (cs, barToken (n + 1))
274        | isClock c                  = clock (n + 1) cs
275    clock n cs                       = (cs, barToken n)
